title: Spanish language in the United States
summary: The United States has over 41 million people aged five or older who speak Spanish at home,[1] making Spanish the second most spoken language in the United States. Spanish is the most studied language other than English in the United States,[3] with about six million students.[4] With over 40 million native speakers, heritage language speakers, and second-language speakers, the United States has the second largest Spanish-speaking population in the world after Mexico, surpassing Spain itself.[5][6] About half of all United States Spanish speakers also assessed themselves as speaking English "very well" in the 2000 US Census.[7] That increased to 57% in the 2013â€“2017 American Community Survey.[8] There is an Academy of the Spanish Language located in the United States as well.[9]
